def.dt: :in a circle or in circumference the wheel goes around a tree five feet around
:in, along, or through a circuit the road goes around by the lake
:on all or various sides :in every or any direction papers lying around nothing for miles around
:in close from all sides so as to surround people crowded around
:in or near one's present place or situation wait around awhile
:here and there :from one place to another travels around on business
:to a particular place come around for dinner

dt.un: used with some verbs to indicate repeated or continued action always joking around when he should be serious don't play around with your food

def.dt: :in rotation or succession another winter comes around
:from beginning to end :through mild the year around
:in order the other way around
:in or to an opposite direction or position turn around
:with some approach to exactness :approximately cost around $5
:on all sides of
:so as to encircle or enclose seated around the table
:so as to avoid or get past :on or to another side of find a way around their objections went around the lake around the corner
:near lives around Chicago around the turn of the century
:in all directions outward from look around you
:here and there in or throughout barnstorming around the country
:so as to have a center or basis in a society organized around kinship ties
:about 1 has been up and around for two days
:being in existence, evidence, or circulation the most intelligent of the artists around today R. M. Coates
:gone through many varied experiences :become worldly-wise
:being in effect, continuing, or lasting 24 hours a day :constant around–the–clock surveillance
:considered in or encompassing all aspects :comprehensive the best all–around performance so far
:competent in many fields an all–around performer
:having general utility or merit an all–around tool
:to restore to consciousness :revive
:persuade
:cast about
:come round
:menstruate
:a football play in which an offensive end comes behind the line of scrimmage to take a handoff and attempts to carry the ball around the opposite flank
:to spend time idly, aimlessly, or frivolously
:to engage in casual sexual activity
